from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "Machine",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "AI",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
        record_template: Optional[str] = "{text}",
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
            record_template=record_template or "",
        )

code.value:
import json
import time
from typing import List

import requests

from axiestudio import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
from axiestudio.utils.constants import LOADERS_INFO
from loguru import logger

class AssemblyAITranscriber(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "AssemblyAI Transcriber"
    description: str = "Transcribe an audio file using AssemblyAI"
    documentation: str = "https://docs.assemblyai.com/"
    output_types: list[str] = ["Record"]

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "api_key": {
                "display_name": "Assembly API Key",
                "field_type": "str",
                "password": True,
                "required": True,
                "info": "Your AssemblyAI API key. You can get one from https://www.assemblyai.com/",
            },
            "audio_file": {
                "display_name": "Audio File",
                "required": True,
                "field_type": "file",
                "file_types": ["mp3", "mp4", "wav", "m4a",".mkv"],
                "suffixes": [".mp3", "mp4", ".wav", ".m4a",".mkv"],
            },
            "language": {
                "display_name": "Language",
                "field_type": "str",
                "required": True,
                "options": [
                    "en",
                    "es",
                    "fr",
                    "de",
                    "it",
                    "pt",
                    "ja",
                    "ko",
                    "hi",
                    "ar",
                    "ru",
                    "zh",
                ],
                "value": "en",
                "info": "The language of the audio file.",
            },
        }

    def upload_audio_file(self, audio_file: str, headers: dict) -> str:
        """Uploads audio file to AssemblyAI and returns upload URL."""
        base_url = "https://api.assemblyai.com/v2"
        with open(audio_file, "rb") as f:
            response = requests.post(base_url + "/upload", headers=headers, data=f)
        upload_url = response.json()["upload_url"]
        return upload_url

    def create_transcription_request(self, upload_url: str, headers: dict, language: str) -> str:
        """Creates a transcription request and returns the transcription ID."""
        data = {"audio_url": upload_url, "language_code": language}
        url = "https://api.assemblyai.com/v2/transcript"
        response = requests.post(url, json=data, headers=headers)
        transcript_id = response.json()["id"]
        return transcript_id

    def poll_transcription_status(self, transcript_id: str, headers: dict) -> Record:
        """Polls the transcription status until completion and returns the Record."""
        polling_endpoint = f"https://api.assemblyai.com/v2/transcript/{transcript_id}"
        while True:
            transcription_result = requests.get(polling_endpoint, headers=headers).json()
            logger.debug(transcription_result)

            if transcription_result["status"] == "completed":
                self.status = "Transcription completed"
                return Record(data=transcription_result, text=transcription_result['text'])

            elif transcription_result["status"] == "error":
                raise RuntimeError(f"Transcription failed: {transcription_result['error']}")

            else:
                time.sleep(3)

    def build(self, audio_file: str, api_key: str, language: str,) -> str:
        headers = {"authorization": api_key}

        upload_url = self.upload_audio_file(audio_file, headers)
        transcript_id = self.create_transcription_request(upload_url, headers, language)
        transcription_result = self.poll_transcription_status(transcript_id, headers)
        return transcription_result.text

code.value:
from typing import Optional

from langchain_anthropic.chat_models import ChatAnthropic
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text


class AnthropicLLM(LCModelComponent):
    display_name: str = "Anthropic"
    description: str = "Generate text using Anthropic Chat&Completion LLMs."
    icon = "Anthropic"

    field_order = [
        "model",
        "anthropic_api_key",
        "max_tokens",
        "temperature",
        "anthropic_api_url",
        "input_value",
        "system_message",
        "stream",
    ]

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "model": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "options": [
                    "claude-3-opus-20240229",
                    "claude-3-sonnet-20240229",
                    "claude-3-haiku-20240307",
                    "claude-2.1",
                    "claude-2.0",
                    "claude-instant-1.2",
                    "claude-instant-1",
                ],
                "info": "https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/anthropic",
                "required": True,
                "value": "claude-3-opus-20240229",
            },
            "anthropic_api_key": {
                "display_name": "Anthropic API Key",
                "required": True,
                "password": True,
                "info": "Your Anthropic API key.",
            },
            "max_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max Tokens",
                "field_type": "int",
                "advanced": True,
                "value": 256,
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "field_type": "float",
                "value": 0.1,
            },
            "anthropic_api_url": {
                "display_name": "Anthropic API URL",
                "advanced": True,
                "info": "Endpoint of the Anthropic API. Defaults to 'https://api.anthropic.com' if not specified.",
            },
            "code": {"show": False},
            "input_value": {"display_name": "Input"},
            "stream": {
                "display_name": "Stream",
                "advanced": True,
                "info": STREAM_INFO_TEXT,
            },
            "system_message": {
                "display_name": "System Message",
                "advanced": True,
                "info": "System message to pass to the model.",
            },
        }

    def build(
        self,
        model: str,
        input_value: Text,
        system_message: Optional[str] = None,
        anthropic_api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        max_tokens: Optional[int] = None,
        temperature: Optional[float] = None,
        anthropic_api_url: Optional[str] = None,
        stream: bool = False,
    ) -> Text:
        # Set default API endpoint if not provided
        if not anthropic_api_url:
            anthropic_api_url = "https://api.anthropic.com"

        try:
            output = ChatAnthropic(
                model_name=model,
                anthropic_api_key=(SecretStr(anthropic_api_key) if anthropic_api_key else None),
                max_tokens_to_sample=max_tokens,  # type: ignore
                temperature=temperature,
                anthropic_api_url=anthropic_api_url,
            )
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not connect to Anthropic API.") from e

        return self.get_chat_result(output, stream, input_value, system_message)

from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"

    def build_config(self):
        build_config = super().build_config()
        build_config["input_value"] = {
            "input_types": [],
            "display_name": "Message",
            "multiline": True,
        }

        return build_config

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "User",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "User",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_no_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
        )

template.value:
<Instructions>
Your task is to generate a long, comprehensive, detailed notes capturing all the key information from a YouTube video, which will be used to create a blog post about the video's content.

The video transcript will be provided in the {{TRANSCRIPT}} variable. This is the primary input you should use to identify and extract all relevant details, facts, examples, and key points covered in the video.

{{USER_INSTRUCTIONS}} will contain any additional guidance from the user on specific aspects to focus on, desired organization, or key themes to emphasize. Carefully follow these instructions to ensure the notes meet the user's needs.

Here are the steps to follow:

1. Thoroughly review the {{TRANSCRIPT}}, noting down all significant information shared, including main topics, subtopics, examples, statistics, quotes, and any other details that contribute to the overall message of the video. Maintain the original language and terminology used in the video.

2. Examine the {{USER_INSTRUCTIONS}} and create a checklist of specific requirements to address, such as highlighting particular sections, emphasizing certain themes, or structuring the notes in a specific way.

3. Begin outlining the notes using clear headings and subheadings that correspond to the main topics and subtopics discussed in the video. Mirror the language used in the transcript to maintain consistency.

4. Under each section, provide detailed bullet points capturing all relevant information shared in the video. Include specific examples, data points, quotes, and any other supporting details that help convey the full scope of what was discussed.

5. Use formatting to highlight key facts, statistics, or important quotes. For example: "**Key Fact: Over 50% of respondents preferred Product A.**"

6. If the video includes any actionable advice or recommendations, call them out using formatting like: "[RECOMMENDATION] *Try implementing Strategy X for best results.*"

7. For any references to external sources or additional information mentioned in the video, include placeholders like: "[EXTERNAL LINK] *Article on XYZ topic: [insert URL here]*"

8. After the main content sections, include a "Key Takeaways" section summarizing the most important points and overall message of the video.

9. End with a "Additional Resources" section listing any external links, recommended reading, or other relevant sources mentioned in the video.

10. Conclude with a <reflection> evaluating how comprehensively the notes capture the video's content and key messages. Provide suggestions for improvement or additional points to consider.


Once complete, review your notes and ensure they meet the following criteria:
- Comprehensively cover all significant information and details from the {{TRANSCRIPT}} 
- Address the specific points and requirements outlined in the {{USER_INSTRUCTIONS}}
- Utilize clear organization and formatting, including headings, bullet points, and Markdown syntax
- Provide sufficient detail and context to serve as a standalone resource for creating a blog post
- Highlight key facts, quotes, recommendations, and external resources
- Follow a logical structure that mirrors the flow of information in the video

Submit your final video notes using the following high-level outline:
# Video Title
## Main Topic 1
### Subtopic 1a
### Subtopic 1b
## Main Topic 2
### Subtopic 2a
### Subtopic 2b 
## Main Topic 3
### Subtopic 3a
### Subtopic 3b
## Key Takeaways
## Additional Resources

Remember, your aim is to transform the video transcript into a long, thorough, well-organized resource that captures all the necessary information to develop a comprehensive blog post. Let me know if you have any additional questions!

Your final output should contain ONLY the long video notes, without any extra comments or reflections.

</Instructions>
<Inputs>
<TRANSCRIPT>
{TRANSCRIPT}
</TRANSCRIPT>
</Inputs>

template.value:
As a content writing assistant, your task is to help the user create a comprehensive blog post based on the main points and ideas presented in a video transcript summary. The blog post should be informative, engaging, and well-structured, with relevant examples, anecdotes, or personal insights to make the content more relatable and interesting to readers.

Based on the following Video transcript summary:
```
{transcript}
```

To generate the initial blog post draft (Draft 1), follow these steps:

1. Begin with a captivating introduction that hooks the reader and provides context for the video's topic.

2. Divide the main content into several paragraphs or sections, each focusing on a specific point from the video summary. Elaborate on these points, providing additional information, explanations, and examples to support the ideas presented.

3. Share your own insights, opinions, or analysis related to the video's content. Discuss the implications, potential applications, or broader context of the ideas presented.

4. Embed the video within the content: Suggest an appropriate place in the article to embed the video. This should enhance understanding and engagement by allowing readers to view the video that complements the textual content.

5. Summarize the key takeaways from the video and your blog post in the conclusion. Provide a thought-provoking conclusion that encourages readers to reflect on the topic or take action.

6. Use appropriate headings, subheadings, bullet points, and formatting to make the blog post visually appealing and easy to read. Ensure that the formatted text is in markdown format.

7. The blog post should be approximately 800-1200 words long, providing sufficient detail and depth without overwhelming the reader.

After generating Draft 1, engage in a dialogue with the user to gather their feedback and suggestions. Ask the user if they would like you to incorporate any additional content or make specific changes to the draft.

# Revision Process
If the user provides feedback or requests changes:
1. Acknowledge the user's feedback and suggestions.
2. Clarify any specific details or requirements if needed.
3. Explain how you plan to incorporate their feedback into the next draft.
4. Generate a revised version of the blog post (Draft 2, Draft 3, etc.) based on the user's input.

During the revision process, focus on:
- Modifying the tone or style of the writing
- Adding or removing specific examples or anecdotes
- Clarifying or expanding on certain points
- Restructuring the content for better flow and readability

Continue the conversation with the user, making iterations to the blog post until they are satisfied with the final result.

When responding, please format your entire response as a JSON object with the following structure:
(
"answer": "Your direct response to the user's query", 
"article": "The generated blog post content in markdown format, always starting with 'Draft X' where X is the current draft number", 
"title": "The generated blog post title" 
)

# Important notes:
- Always include the 'answer' key with your direct response.
- If a blog post has been generated, include the content under the 'article' key (always starting with "Draft X" at the beginning, where X is the current draft number) and the title under the 'title' key.
- If no blog post has been generated yet or during the revision process, omit the 'article' and 'title' keys entirely.
- When the user provides feedback or requests changes, do not generate a new draft right away. Instead, acknowledge their input, ask for clarification if needed, and explain how you plan to incorporate their suggestions in the next draft. Only generate the revised draft after confirming the changes with the user.

Chat History:
```
{history}
```

User Request:
**{input}**

import json
import time
from typing import List

import requests

from axiestudio import CustomComponent
from axiestudio.schema import Record
from axiestudio.utils.constants import LOADERS_INFO
from loguru import logger

class AssemblyAITranscriber(CustomComponent):
    display_name: str = "AssemblyAI Transcriber"
    description: str = "Transcribe an audio file using AssemblyAI"
    documentation: str = "https://docs.assemblyai.com/"
    output_types: list[str] = ["Record"]

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "api_key": {
                "display_name": "Assembly API Key",
                "field_type": "str",
                "password": True,
                "required": True,
                "info": "Your AssemblyAI API key. You can get one from https://www.assemblyai.com/",
            },
            "audio_file": {
                "display_name": "Audio File",
                "required": True,
                "field_type": "file",
                "file_types": ["mp3", "mp4", "wav", "m4a",".mkv"],
                "suffixes": [".mp3", "mp4", ".wav", ".m4a",".mkv"],
            },
            "language": {
                "display_name": "Language",
                "field_type": "str",
                "required": True,
                "options": [
                    "en",
                    "es",
                    "fr",
                    "de",
                    "it",
                    "pt",
                    "ja",
                    "ko",
                    "hi",
                    "ar",
                    "ru",
                    "zh",
                ],
                "value": "en",
                "info": "The language of the audio file.",
            },
        }

    def upload_audio_file(self, audio_file: str, headers: dict) -> str:
        """Uploads audio file to AssemblyAI and returns upload URL."""
        base_url = "https://api.assemblyai.com/v2"
        with open(audio_file, "rb") as f:
            response = requests.post(base_url + "/upload", headers=headers, data=f)
        upload_url = response.json()["upload_url"]
        return upload_url

    def create_transcription_request(self, upload_url: str, headers: dict, language: str) -> str:
        """Creates a transcription request and returns the transcription ID."""
        data = {"audio_url": upload_url, "language_code": language}
        url = "https://api.assemblyai.com/v2/transcript"
        response = requests.post(url, json=data, headers=headers)
        transcript_id = response.json()["id"]
        return transcript_id

    def poll_transcription_status(self, transcript_id: str, headers: dict) -> Record:
        """Polls the transcription status until completion and returns the Record."""
        polling_endpoint = f"https://api.assemblyai.com/v2/transcript/{transcript_id}"
        while True:
            transcription_result = requests.get(polling_endpoint, headers=headers).json()
            logger.debug(transcription_result)

            if transcription_result["status"] == "completed":
                self.status = "Transcription completed"
                return Record(data=transcription_result, text=transcription_result['text'])

            elif transcription_result["status"] == "error":
                raise RuntimeError(f"Transcription failed: {transcription_result['error']}")

            else:
                time.sleep(3)

    def build(self, audio_file: str, api_key: str, language: str,) -> str:
        headers = {"authorization": api_key}

        upload_url = self.upload_audio_file(audio_file, headers)
        transcript_id = self.create_transcription_request(upload_url, headers, language)
        transcription_result = self.poll_transcription_status(transcript_id, headers)
        return transcription_result.text

code.value:
from typing import Optional

from langchain_anthropic.chat_models import ChatAnthropic
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.constants import STREAM_INFO_TEXT
from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text


class AnthropicLLM(LCModelComponent):
    display_name: str = "Anthropic"
    description: str = "Generate text using Anthropic Chat&Completion LLMs."
    icon = "Anthropic"

    field_order = [
        "model",
        "anthropic_api_key",
        "max_tokens",
        "temperature",
        "anthropic_api_url",
        "input_value",
        "system_message",
        "stream",
    ]

    def build_config(self):
        return {
            "model": {
                "display_name": "Model Name",
                "options": [
                    "claude-3-opus-20240229",
                    "claude-3-sonnet-20240229",
                    "claude-3-haiku-20240307",
                    "claude-2.1",
                    "claude-2.0",
                    "claude-instant-1.2",
                    "claude-instant-1",
                ],
                "info": "https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/anthropic",
                "required": True,
                "value": "claude-3-opus-20240229",
            },
            "anthropic_api_key": {
                "display_name": "Anthropic API Key",
                "required": True,
                "password": True,
                "info": "Your Anthropic API key.",
            },
            "max_tokens": {
                "display_name": "Max Tokens",
                "field_type": "int",
                "advanced": True,
                "value": 256,
            },
            "temperature": {
                "display_name": "Temperature",
                "field_type": "float",
                "value": 0.1,
            },
            "anthropic_api_url": {
                "display_name": "Anthropic API URL",
                "advanced": True,
                "info": "Endpoint of the Anthropic API. Defaults to 'https://api.anthropic.com' if not specified.",
            },
            "code": {"show": False},
            "input_value": {"display_name": "Input"},
            "stream": {
                "display_name": "Stream",
                "advanced": True,
                "info": STREAM_INFO_TEXT,
            },
            "system_message": {
                "display_name": "System Message",
                "advanced": True,
                "info": "System message to pass to the model.",
            },
        }

    def build(
        self,
        model: str,
        input_value: Text,
        system_message: Optional[str] = None,
        anthropic_api_key: Optional[str] = None,
        max_tokens: Optional[int] = None,
        temperature: Optional[float] = None,
        anthropic_api_url: Optional[str] = None,
        stream: bool = False,
    ) -> Text:
        # Set default API endpoint if not provided
        if not anthropic_api_url:
            anthropic_api_url = "https://api.anthropic.com"

        try:
            output = ChatAnthropic(
                model_name=model,
                anthropic_api_key=(SecretStr(anthropic_api_key) if anthropic_api_key else None),
                max_tokens_to_sample=max_tokens,  # type: ignore
                temperature=temperature,
                anthropic_api_url=anthropic_api_url,
            )
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not connect to Anthropic API.") from e

        return self.get_chat_result(output, stream, input_value, system_message)

from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatInput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Input"
    description = "Get chat inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "ChatInput"

    def build_config(self):
        build_config = super().build_config()
        build_config["input_value"] = {
            "input_types": [],
            "display_name": "Message",
            "multiline": True,
        }

        return build_config

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "User",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "User",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_no_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
        )

template.value:
<Instructions>
Your task is to generate a long, comprehensive, detailed notes capturing all the key information from a YouTube video, which will be used to create a blog post about the video's content.

The video transcript will be provided in the {{TRANSCRIPT}} variable. This is the primary input you should use to identify and extract all relevant details, facts, examples, and key points covered in the video.

{{USER_INSTRUCTIONS}} will contain any additional guidance from the user on specific aspects to focus on, desired organization, or key themes to emphasize. Carefully follow these instructions to ensure the notes meet the user's needs.

Here are the steps to follow:

1. Thoroughly review the {{TRANSCRIPT}}, noting down all significant information shared, including main topics, subtopics, examples, statistics, quotes, and any other details that contribute to the overall message of the video. Maintain the original language and terminology used in the video.

2. Examine the {{USER_INSTRUCTIONS}} and create a checklist of specific requirements to address, such as highlighting particular sections, emphasizing certain themes, or structuring the notes in a specific way.

3. Begin outlining the notes using clear headings and subheadings that correspond to the main topics and subtopics discussed in the video. Mirror the language used in the transcript to maintain consistency.

4. Under each section, provide detailed bullet points capturing all relevant information shared in the video. Include specific examples, data points, quotes, and any other supporting details that help convey the full scope of what was discussed.

5. Use formatting to highlight key facts, statistics, or important quotes. For example: "**Key Fact: Over 50% of respondents preferred Product A.**"

6. If the video includes any actionable advice or recommendations, call them out using formatting like: "[RECOMMENDATION] *Try implementing Strategy X for best results.*"

7. For any references to external sources or additional information mentioned in the video, include placeholders like: "[EXTERNAL LINK] *Article on XYZ topic: [insert URL here]*"

8. After the main content sections, include a "Key Takeaways" section summarizing the most important points and overall message of the video.

9. End with a "Additional Resources" section listing any external links, recommended reading, or other relevant sources mentioned in the video.

10. Conclude with a <reflection> evaluating how comprehensively the notes capture the video's content and key messages. Provide suggestions for improvement or additional points to consider.


Once complete, review your notes and ensure they meet the following criteria:
- Comprehensively cover all significant information and details from the {{TRANSCRIPT}} 
- Address the specific points and requirements outlined in the {{USER_INSTRUCTIONS}}
- Utilize clear organization and formatting, including headings, bullet points, and Markdown syntax
- Provide sufficient detail and context to serve as a standalone resource for creating a blog post
- Highlight key facts, quotes, recommendations, and external resources
- Follow a logical structure that mirrors the flow of information in the video

Submit your final video notes using the following high-level outline:
# Video Title
## Main Topic 1
### Subtopic 1a
### Subtopic 1b
## Main Topic 2
### Subtopic 2a
### Subtopic 2b 
## Main Topic 3
### Subtopic 3a
### Subtopic 3b
## Key Takeaways
## Additional Resources

Remember, your aim is to transform the video transcript into a long, thorough, well-organized resource that captures all the necessary information to develop a comprehensive blog post. Let me know if you have any additional questions!

Your final output should contain ONLY the long video notes, without any extra comments or reflections.

</Instructions>
<Inputs>
<TRANSCRIPT>
{TRANSCRIPT}
</TRANSCRIPT>
</Inputs>

template.value:
As a content writing assistant, your task is to help the user create a comprehensive blog post based on the main points and ideas presented in a video transcript summary. The blog post should be informative, engaging, and well-structured, with relevant examples, anecdotes, or personal insights to make the content more relatable and interesting to readers.

Based on the following Video transcript summary:
```
{transcript}
```

To generate the initial blog post draft (Draft 1), follow these steps:

1. Begin with a captivating introduction that hooks the reader and provides context for the video's topic.

2. Divide the main content into several paragraphs or sections, each focusing on a specific point from the video summary. Elaborate on these points, providing additional information, explanations, and examples to support the ideas presented.

3. Share your own insights, opinions, or analysis related to the video's content. Discuss the implications, potential applications, or broader context of the ideas presented.

4. Embed the video within the content: Suggest an appropriate place in the article to embed the video. This should enhance understanding and engagement by allowing readers to view the video that complements the textual content.

5. Summarize the key takeaways from the video and your blog post in the conclusion. Provide a thought-provoking conclusion that encourages readers to reflect on the topic or take action.

6. Use appropriate headings, subheadings, bullet points, and formatting to make the blog post visually appealing and easy to read. Ensure that the formatted text is in markdown format.

7. The blog post should be approximately 800-1200 words long, providing sufficient detail and depth without overwhelming the reader.

After generating Draft 1, engage in a dialogue with the user to gather their feedback and suggestions. Ask the user if they would like you to incorporate any additional content or make specific changes to the draft.

# Revision Process
If the user provides feedback or requests changes:
1. Acknowledge the user's feedback and suggestions.
2. Clarify any specific details or requirements if needed.
3. Explain how you plan to incorporate their feedback into the next draft.
4. Generate a revised version of the blog post (Draft 2, Draft 3, etc.) based on the user's input.

During the revision process, focus on:
- Modifying the tone or style of the writing
- Adding or removing specific examples or anecdotes
- Clarifying or expanding on certain points
- Restructuring the content for better flow and readability

Continue the conversation with the user, making iterations to the blog post until they are satisfied with the final result.

When responding, please format your entire response as a JSON object with the following structure:
(
"answer": "Your direct response to the user's query", 
"article": "The generated blog post content in markdown format, always starting with 'Draft X' where X is the current draft number", 
"title": "The generated blog post title" 
)

# Important notes:
- Always include the 'answer' key with your direct response.
- If a blog post has been generated, include the content under the 'article' key (always starting with "Draft X" at the beginning, where X is the current draft number) and the title under the 'title' key.
- If no blog post has been generated yet or during the revision process, omit the 'article' and 'title' keys entirely.
- When the user provides feedback or requests changes, do not generate a new draft right away. Instead, acknowledge their input, ask for clarification if needed, and explain how you plan to incorporate their suggestions in the next draft. Only generate the revised draft after confirming the changes with the user.

Chat History:
```
{history}
```

User Request:
**{input}**

from typing import Optional, Union

from axiestudio.base.io.chat import ChatComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import Text
from axiestudio.schema import Record


class ChatOutput(ChatComponent):
    display_name = "Chat Output"
    description = "Display a chat message in the Playground."
    icon = "ChatOutput"

    def build(
        self,
        sender: Optional[str] = "Machine",
        sender_name: Optional[str] = "AI",
        input_value: Optional[str] = None,
        session_id: Optional[str] = None,
        return_record: Optional[bool] = False,
        record_template: Optional[str] = "{text}",
    ) -> Union[Text, Record]:
        return super().build_with_record(
            sender=sender,
            sender_name=sender_name,
            input_value=input_value,
            session_id=session_id,
            return_record=return_record,
            record_template=record_template or "",
        )
